t: Ezekiel 7
The End Has Come
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, this is what the Sovereign Lord*s says to the land of Israel: “ ‘The*pn end! The end has come upon*ld the four corners of the land!
The*ln end is now upon you, and*ld I will unleash my anger against you. I*ln will judge you according to your conduct and*ld repay you for all your detestable practices.
I*ln will not look on you with pity; I*ld will not spare you. I*ln will surely repay you for your conduct and*ld for the detestable practices among you. “ ‘Then*p you will know that I am the Lord.’*s
“This*p is what the Sovereign Lord*s says: “ ‘Disaster!*pn Unheard-of disaster! See,*ld it comes!
The*ln end has come! The*ld end has come! It*ln has roused itself against you. See,*ld it comes!
Doom*ln has come upon you, upon*ld you who dwell in the land. The*ln time has come! The day is near! There*ld is panic, not joy, on the mountains.
I*ln am about to pour out my wrath on you and*ld spend my anger against you. I*ln will judge you according to your conduct and*ld repay you for all your detestable practices.

I*ln will not look on you with pity; I*ld will not spare you. I*ln will repay you for your conduct and*ld for the detestable practices among you. “ ‘Then*p you will know that it is I the Lord*s who strikes you.
“ ‘See,*pn the day! See,*ld it comes! Doom*ln has burst forth, the*ld rod has budded, arrogance*ld has blossomed!
Violence*ln has arisen, a*ld rod to punish the wicked. None*ln of the people will be left, none*ld of that crowd— none*ln of their wealth, nothing*ld of value.
The*ln time has come! The*ld day has arrived! Let*ln not the buyer rejoice nor*ld the seller grieve, for*ld my wrath is on the whole crowd.

The*ln seller will not recover the*ld property that was sold— as*ld long as both buyer and seller live. For*ln the vision concerning the whole crowd will*ld not be reversed. Because*ln of their sins, not one of them will*ld preserve their life.
“ ‘They*pn have blown the trumpet, they*ld have made all things ready, but*ln no one will go into battle, for*ld my wrath is on the whole crowd.
Outside*ln is the sword; inside*ld are plague and famine. Those*ln in the country will*ld die by the sword; those*ln in the city will*ld be devoured by famine and plague.

Every*ln hand will go limp; every*ld leg will be wet with urine.
They*ln will put on sackcloth and*ld be clothed with terror. Every*ln face will be covered with shame, and*ld every head will be shaved.

“ ‘They*pn will throw their silver into the streets, and*ld their gold will be treated as a thing unclean. Their*ln silver and gold will*ld not be able to deliver them in*ld the day of the Lord’s*s wrath. It*ln will not satisfy their hunger or*ld fill their stomachs, for*ld it has caused them to stumble into sin.
They*ln took pride in their beautiful jewelry and*ld used it to make their detestable idols. They*ln made it into vile images; therefore*ld I will make it a thing unclean for them.
I*ln will give their wealth as plunder to foreigners and*ld as loot to the wicked of the earth, who*ld will defile it.

“ ‘Prepare*pn chains! For*ld the land is full of bloodshed, and*ld the city is full of violence.
I*ln will bring the most wicked of nations to*ld take possession of their houses. I*ln will put an end to the pride of the mighty, and*ld their sanctuaries will be desecrated.
When*ln terror comes, they*ld will seek peace in vain.

Calamity*ln upon calamity will come, and*ld rumor upon rumor. They*ln will go searching for a vision from the prophet, priestly*ld instruction in the law will cease, the*ld counsel of the elders will come to an end.

The*ln king will mourn, the*ld prince will be clothed with despair, and*ld the hands of the people of the land will tremble. I*ln will deal with them according to their conduct, and*ld by their own standards I will judge them. “ ‘Then*p they will know that I am the Lord*s .’ ”
